Articles.Content:
KSP: 1.1.3 Windows x64

Problem: When AtmosphereAutopilot (Boris-Barboris) is activated, spacecraft can't be recovered, and KSP freezes. The "RECOVER" button does nothing, same for "SPACE CENTER". The toolbars disappear. The simulation continues to run, but there is no other way than Alt-F4 to exit. It is still possible to use F5 or Alt-F5 for saves. Deleting the mod folder reverts the situation to normal.

Mods installed:

- Chatterer v0.9.90 [26 Jun 2016)
- RemoteTech v1.7.1 [02 Jul 2016)
- TAC Life Support v0.12.2 [02 Jul 2016)

- AtmosphereAutopilot 1.5.5
- ModuleManager.2.6.25.dll

Reproduction steps:

1) Launch a craft and activate AtmosphereAutopilot "Master Switch". That's it, KSP gets in a frozen state, and you can't recover the spacecraft or switch to the Space Center.

2) Launch a craft with any kind of crewed pod. EVA a Kerbal. Try to get him back. You get a nice clone.

3) Delete AtmosphereAutopilot mod folder from Gamedata. Resume your "frozen game". Everything is back to normal and the clone is gone.

Log:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B5brcxNWL4akYzJUY0hEYXNHU1E

You could just post the logs in AA's topic and not create a new one.

You're using vessel name, that contains unicode symbols and quotation marks. AA is indeed not carefull enough and crashes the game, but you have lots of stock errors happening too because of that. Avoid non-English and special symbols in vessel names.

For AA, use https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/23572905/KSP_Mods/AtmosphereAutopilot/AtmosphereAutopilot_1.5.6.zip ,

it should not crash, but the core of the problem is your vessel names, you'll be in trouble if you keep using those.

Edited July 9, 2016 by Boris-Barboris

Thanks a lot, makes sense !

Yep, I'm using a "AZERTY" keyboard, and here we learn to use "..." for quotations, while the "QWERTY" standard uses '...'

I'll be careful about that.

EDIT : replaced all the " by ' in my craft designs, fixed all the problems. Nice !

Edited July 9, 2016 by N_Molson
Issue solved
